synthesis_method: The electrolyte synthesis process involves mixing powders of Li2CO3, Y2O3, ZrO2, and NH4H2PO4 to form an internal component, calcining the mixture at 800°C, testing its composition via XRD, creating a composite by adding LiOH, H3BO3, and NH4H2PO4 to the internal component, adjusting the pH to form a uniform gel, drying the composite, molding it into sheets, heat treating the sheets at 1000°C for 24 hours to obtain a solid electrolyte A1 for lithium ion batteries.
